intro: Hedyotis lancelimba, commonly known as the slender bladdernut, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white flowers are borne in clusters and are accompanied by small, bladder-like structures, which give it its common name. Hedyotis lancelimba is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
